{"twitter_image":"https://img-b.udemycdn.com/course/480x270/2234172_e3c9.jpg","site":"https://www.udemy.com/course/tax-credits-2018-2019-family-dependent-tax-credits/?couponCode=A77FC97E408346D1EE02","course_language":"English","is_free":"true","description":"Earned income tax credit, child tax credit, child & dependent care credit, credit for elderly or the disabled, Adoption","id":"213","title":"Tax Credits - Family & Dependent Tax Credits","category":"Office Productivity","url":"tax-credits-2018-2019-family-dependent-tax-credits","course_description":"<div class=\"ud-text-sm component-margin styles--description--33-vq\" data-purpose=\"course-description\"><h2 data-purpose=\"description-title\" class=\"ud-heading-xl styles--description__header--2Z7Vb\">Description<\/h2><div class=\"show-more-module--container--2QPRN\"><span id=\"u85-show-more--6\" data-type=\"checkbox\" data-checked=\"\" style=\"display:none\"><\/span><div class=\"show-more-module--content--cjTh0 show-more-module--with-gradient--1ZDrA\" style=\"max-height:none\"><div tabindex=\"-1\"><div data-purpose=\"safely-set-inner-html:description:description\"><p>Family &amp; dependent tax credits in 2018 including the earned income tax credit, child tax credit, child &amp; dependent care tax credit, other dependents tax credit, credit for elderly or the disabled, and adoption tax credit.<\/p><p>This course will provide a detailed look at these tax credits, including a discussion of the amount of the tax credits and the qualifications to take the tax credits.<\/p><p>We will use tax software and forms to show how the tax credits are input into the tax forms and to test variations in qualifications for the tax credits including income limitations. Using tax software to experiment with different scenarios is a very effective way to learn about how tax credits actually operate.<\/p><p>For example, running tax scenarios using tax software is the only way most people will be able to see clearly the difference between the child tax credit (CTC) and the additional child tax credit (ACTC). Running tax scenarios can also help us understand how the child tax credit (CTC), additional child tax credit (ACTC), and earned income tax credit (EIC) will work as income levels and the number of children is adjusted.<\/p><p>We will provide PDF files that can be downloaded and used as references without an internet connection.<\/p><p>The course will also provide PDF documents of relevant publications and forms.<\/p><\/div><div class=\"styles--audience--2xuzW\" data-purpose=\"target-audience\"><h2 class=\"ud-heading-xl styles--audience__title--1qhlO\">Who this course is for:<\/h2><ul class=\"styles--audience__list--16EaN\"><li>Anybody who wants to save on taxes<\/li><li>Tax professionals<\/li><\/ul><\/div><\/div><\/div><button type=\"button\" class=\"ud-btn ud-btn-medium ud-btn-ghost ud-heading-sm show-more-module--focusable-label--19jtd\" style=\"display: none;\" data-css-toggle-id=\"u85-show-more--6\"><span><span class=\"show-more-module--show-more--2bohq\">Show more<\/span><span class=\"show-more-module--show-less--1J4F5\">Show less<\/span><\/span><svg aria-hidden=\"true\" focusable=\"false\" class=\"ud-icon ud-icon-xsmall show-more-module--show-more--2bohq\"><use xlink:href=\"#icon-expand\"><\/use><\/svg><svg aria-hidden=\"true\" focusable=\"false\" class=\"ud-icon ud-icon-xsmall show-more-module--show-less--1J4F5\"><use xlink:href=\"#icon-collapse\"><\/use><\/svg><\/button><\/div><\/div>"}
{"twitter_image":"https://img-c.udemycdn.com/course/480x270/2207674_f71d.jpg","site":"https://www.udemy.com/course/quickbooks-online-2019-bookkeeping-business-easy-way/?couponCode=D4DF3D6173DBF2567A98","course_language":"English","is_free":"true","description":"QuickBooks Online bookkeeping business plan and examples, walking through bookkeeping engagement & data entry","id":"214","title":"QuickBooks Online-Bookkeeping Business-Easy Way","category":"Office Productivity","url":"quickbooks-online-2019-bookkeeping-business-easy-way","course_description":"<div class=\"ud-text-sm component-margin styles--description--33-vq\" data-purpose=\"course-description\"><h2 data-purpose=\"description-title\" class=\"ud-heading-xl styles--description__header--2Z7Vb\">Description<\/h2><div class=\"show-more-module--container--2QPRN\"><span id=\"u18-show-more--7\" data-type=\"checkbox\" data-checked=\"\" style=\"display:none\"><\/span><div class=\"show-more-module--content--cjTh0 show-more-module--with-gradient--1ZDrA\" style=\"max-height:none\"><div tabindex=\"-1\"><div data-purpose=\"safely-set-inner-html:description:description\"><p><strong>QuickBooks Online bookkeeping business designed for small business clients or small businesses who want a simple cash basis format for entering data.  <\/strong><\/p><p><strong>This course is designed for bookkeepers and is also useful for small business owners who want a simple system for entering financial data into QuickBooks for financial planning and year-end tax preparation. <\/strong><\/p><p>The bookkeeping system we discuss will also describe the relationship between the bookkeeper, the business, and the year-end tax and financial statement preparers. <\/p><p>We will outline a cash basis bookkeeping system using QuickBooks, a system that will enter most transactions directly into the check register. <\/p><p>The course will discuss the responsibilities of a bookkeeper and the responsibilities of the business when a bookkeeping engagement in entered into.  <\/p><p>We will work through a sample bookkeeping project in QuickBooks including the setting up of a new QuickBooks company file. <\/p><p>The course will practice entering data into the QuickBooks register directly from a bank statement. We will provide practice bank statements to use with the project as well as step by step instructional videos. <\/p><p>As we enter data directly into the check register from the bank statement, we will compare and contrast the cash basis system we are using to a full accounting cycle system. We will also review the financial statements periodically to see how QuickBooks is using the data to make reports. <\/p><p>After entering data into the QuickBooks check register from the bank statement, we will perform bank reconciliations. As we perform bank reconciliations, we will discuss what a bank reconciliation is and the benefits a bank reconciliation provides. <\/p><p>The course will then discuss options for entering specific accounting data into QuickBooks including payroll, equipment, loan payments, insurance, credit card payments, and invoices. We will provide practice QuickBooks files for different options related to the items listed above and explore the pros and cons of each option. The bookkeeping options will help tailor our system to our specific bookkeeping needs. <\/p><p>As we enter accounting data into the system we will discuss common questions we will have when entering the first few months of data and how to write down these questions, move forward with data input, and organize the financial data so that we can quickly go back to it once our client questions are answered. <\/p><p>This course will discuss, print, and export month end and year end reports, reports a bookkeeper may provide to clients monthly and reports the business will need at year-end for tax preparation. <\/p><p>We will discuss year-end adjusting entries. The bookkeeping system we propose will depend on an outside accounting firm, tax preparer, or CPA firm to help with the year-end adjusting entries. As bookkeepers we want to be aware of the adjusting entry process so we can work with any year-end accounting firm, tax preparer, or CPA firm. We will enter common adjusting entries into an adjusting entry Excel worksheet and into Quickbooks. <\/p><p>Finally, we will discuss whether or not to enter the year-end adjusting entries into our QuickBooks bookkeeping system and different options to do so. <\/p><p>In addition to the instructional videos, this course will include downloadable   <\/p><p>\u2022    Excel practice files<\/p><p>\u2022    Downloadable PDF Files   <\/p><p>Excel practice files will be preformatted and will generally have at least two tabs, one tab with the completed work and a second tab with a preformatted worksheet we can fill in as we watch the instructional videos.    <\/p><p>Who will we be learning from?   <\/p><\/div><div class=\"styles--audience--2xuzW\" data-purpose=\"target-audience\"><h2 class=\"ud-heading-xl styles--audience__title--1qhlO\">Who this course is for:<\/h2><ul class=\"styles--audience__list--16EaN\"><li>Bookkeepers who want do design a bookkeeping business using QuickBooks Pro Online<\/li><li>Small business owners who want a simple system to enter data into QuickBooks Online or prior to help year-end tax preparation &amp; regulatory needs<\/li><li>Small business owners who want to learn how best to work with a bookkeeper and or year-end accounting firm and tax preparer<\/li><li>Students who want to understand bookkeeping from a practical perspective<\/li><\/ul><\/div><\/div><\/div><button type=\"button\" class=\"ud-btn ud-btn-medium ud-btn-ghost ud-heading-sm show-more-module--focusable-label--19jtd\" style=\"display: none;\" data-css-toggle-id=\"u18-show-more--7\"><span><span class=\"show-more-module--show-more--2bohq\">Show more<\/span><span class=\"show-more-module--show-less--1J4F5\">Show less<\/span><\/span><svg aria-hidden=\"true\" focusable=\"false\" class=\"ud-icon ud-icon-xsmall show-more-module--show-more--2bohq\"><use xlink:href=\"#icon-expand\"><\/use><\/svg><svg aria-hidden=\"true\" focusable=\"false\" class=\"ud-icon ud-icon-xsmall show-more-module--show-less--1J4F5\"><use xlink:href=\"#icon-collapse\"><\/use><\/svg><\/button><\/div><\/div>"}

The course will describe how FIT is calculated, what is needed for QuickBooks Online to calculate FIT, and how to enter the data into the accounting system. <\/strong><\/p><p><strong>The course will describe the Federal Income Contributions Act (FICA) and its components. <\/strong><\/p><p><strong>We will calculate social security and describe how QuickBooks Online will help with the calculations as we process payroll. <\/strong><\/p><p><strong>The course will calculate Medicare and describe how QuickBooks Online will help with the calculations of Medicare when we process payroll. <\/strong><\/p><p><strong>We will calculate Federal Unemployment (FUTA) and discuss how FUTA is related to state unemployment (SUTA). <\/strong><\/p><p><strong>The course will describe and calculate employer taxes and discuss which taxes are employee taxes and which taxes are employer taxes. <\/strong><\/p><p><strong>We will describe payroll journal entries and discuss how payroll data is populated in the QuickBooks Online reports and financial statements including the profit and loss and balance sheet. <\/strong><\/p><p><strong>We will discuss and enter both mandatory and voluntary deductions into the QuickBooks Online system. <\/strong><\/p><p><strong>The course will discuss retirement plan options, how to enter them into the QuickBooks Online system, and how they are used to calculate net income and payroll taxes. <\/strong><\/p><p><strong>We will work a comprehensive problem, processing payroll within QuickBooks Online. The comprehensive problem will use the paid QuickBooks Online feature. <\/strong><\/p><p><strong>The comprehensive problem will start very basic with one employee and will increase in complexity as we enter more benefits and payroll details each year.<\/strong><\/p><\/div><div class=\"styles--audience--2xuzW\" data-purpose=\"target-audience\"><h2 class=\"ud-heading-xl styles--audience__title--1qhlO\">Who this course is for:<\/h2><ul class=\"styles--audience__list--16EaN\"><li>Bookkeeper who want to learn how to use QuickBooks Online payroll<\/li><li>Business owners who want to learn QuickBooks Online payroll<\/li><li>Accounting students who want a better understanding of payroll concepts and how they are used in accounting software<\/li><li>Business professionals who want a better understanding of how payroll works<\/li><\/ul><\/div><\/div><\/div><button type=\"button\" class=\"ud-btn ud-btn-medium ud-btn-ghost ud-heading-sm show-more-module--focusable-label--19jtd\" style=\"display: none;\" data-css-toggle-id=\"u173-show-more--7\"><span><span class=\"show-more-module--show-more--2bohq\">Show more<\/span><span class=\"show-more-module--show-less--1J4F5\">Show less<\/span><\/span><svg aria-hidden=\"true\" focusable=\"false\" class=\"ud-icon ud-icon-xsmall show-more-module--show-more--2bohq\"><use xlink:href=\"#icon-expand\"><\/use><\/svg><svg aria-hidden=\"true\" focusable=\"false\" class=\"ud-icon ud-icon-xsmall show-more-module--show-less--1J4F5\"><use xlink:href=\"#icon-collapse\"><\/use><\/svg><\/button><\/div><\/div>"}

Desktop 2019, applying the feature to tracking both business and personal financial information in one QuickBooks file. <\/strong><\/p><p><strong>Note that tracking both business and personal data in one QuickBooks file will not be the best option for many businesses but is a good option for small businesses who want one location to track and analyze financial data and generate financial reports that can be used for tax preparation, budgeting, and business planning. <\/strong><\/p><p><strong>We will set up a QuickBooks file designed for both business and personal use, discussing how to use the class tracking feature and creating a chart of accounts. <\/strong><\/p><p><strong>The course will enter financial data from a bank statement that has both business and personal transactions, separating the financial transactions using the class tracking feature as we enter the data into QuickBooks. <\/strong><\/p><p><strong>We will compare the method of using one QuickBooks account for both business and personal data to using two separate QuickBooks files, one for personal and one for business, listing and describing pros and cons of each method and when they would be best applied. gross pay from the withholding amounts. <\/strong><\/p><p><strong>The course will cover different methods for tracking credit card balances and credit card payments. <\/strong><\/p><p><strong>We will Pro Desktop 2019 bookkeeping business plan and examples, walking through bookkeeping engagement & data entry","id":"218","title":"QuickBooks Pro Desktop -Bookkeeping Business-Easy Way","category":"Business","url":"quickbooks-pro-bookkeeping-the-easy-way-for-small-businesses","course_description":"<div class=\"ud-text-sm component-margin styles--description--33-vq\" data-purpose=\"course-description\"><h2 data-purpose=\"description-title\" class=\"ud-heading-xl styles--description__header--2Z7Vb\">Description<\/h2><div class=\"show-more-module--container--2QPRN\"><span id=\"u83-show-more--7\" data-type=\"checkbox\" data-checked=\"\" style=\"display:none\"><\/span><div class=\"show-more-module--content--cjTh0 show-more-module--with-gradient--1ZDrA\" style=\"max-height:none\"><div tabindex=\"-1\"><div data-purpose=\"safely-set-inner-html:description:description\"><p><strong>QuickBooks pro desktop 2019 bookkeeping business designed for small business clients or small businesses who want a simple cash basis format for entering data.  <\/strong><\/p><p><strong>This course is designed for bookkeepers and is also useful for small business owners who want a simple system for entering financial data into QuickBooks for financial planning and year-end tax preparation. <\/strong><\/p><p>The bookkeeping system we discuss will also describe the relationship between the bookkeeper, the business, and the year-end tax and financial statement preparers. <\/p><p>We will outline a cash basis bookkeeping system using QuickBooks, a system that will enter most transactions directly into the check register. <\/p><p>The course will discuss the responsibilities of a bookkeeper and the responsibilities of the business when a bookkeeping engagement in entered into.  <\/p><p>We will work through a sample bookkeeping project in QuickBooks including the setting up of a new QuickBooks company file. <\/p><p>The course will practice entering data into the QuickBooks register directly from a bank statement. We will provide practice bank statements to use with the project as well as step by step instructional videos. <\/p><p>As we enter data directly into the check register from the bank statement, we will compare and contrast the cash basis system we are using to a full accounting cycle system. We will also review the financial statements periodically to see how QuickBooks is using the data to make reports. <\/p><p>After entering data into the QuickBooks check register from the bank statement, we will perform bank reconciliations. As we perform bank reconciliations, we will discuss what a bank reconciliation is and the benefits a bank reconciliation provides. <\/p><p>The course will then discuss options for entering specific accounting data into QuickBooks including payroll, equipment, loan payments, insurance, credit card payments, and invoices. We will provide practice QuickBooks files for different options related to the items listed above and explore the pros and cons of each option. The bookkeeping options will help tailor our system to our specific bookkeeping needs. <\/p><p>As we enter accounting data into the system we will discuss common questions we will have when entering the first few months of data and how to write down these questions, move forward with data input, and organize the financial data so that we can quickly go back to it once our client questions are answered. <\/p><p>This course will discuss, print, and export month end and year end reports, reports a bookkeeper may provide to clients monthly and reports the business will need at year-end for tax preparation. <\/p><p>We will discuss year-end adjusting entries. The bookkeeping system we propose will depend on an outside accounting firm, tax preparer, or CPA firm to help with the year-end adjusting entries. As bookkeepers we want to be aware of the adjusting entry process so we can work with any year-end accounting firm, tax preparer, or CPA firm. We will enter common adjusting entries into an adjusting entry Excel worksheet and into Quickbooks. <\/p><p>The course will then compare and contrast our different bookkeeping methods and show how those different bookkeeping decisions reconcile to the same numbers after the adjusting entry process. <\/p><p>Finally, we will discuss whether or not to enter the year-end adjusting entries into our QuickBooks bookkeeping system and different options to do so. <\/p><p>In addition to the instructional videos, this course will include downloadable   <\/p><p>\u2022    QuickBooks Backup files<\/p><p>\u2022    Excel practice files<\/p><p>\u2022    Downloadable PDF Files   <\/p><p>The QuickBooks backup files are a great tool that allows us to jump ahead in the material or to rework material if we choose. <\/p><p>Excel practice files will be preformatted and will generally have at least two tabs, one tab with the completed work and a second tab with a preformatted worksheet we can fill in as we watch the instructional videos.    <\/p><p>Who will we be learning from?   <\/p><p>You will be learning from somebody who has technical experience in accounting concepts and in accounting software like QuickBooks, as well as experience teaching and putting together curriculum.   <\/p><p>You will be learning from somebody who is a:   <\/p><p>\u2022    CPA \u2013 Certified Public Accountant   <\/p><p>\u2022    CGMA \u2013 Chartered Global Management Accountant   <\/p><p>\u2022    Master of Science in Taxation   <\/p><p>\u2022    CPS \u2013 Certifies Post-Secondary Instructor   <\/p><p>\u2022    Curriculum Development Export   <\/p><p>As a practicing CPA the instructor has worked with many technical accounting issues and helped work through them and discuss them with clients of all levels.   <\/p><p>As a CPA and professor, the instructor has taught many accounting classes and worked with many students in the fields of accounting, business, and business applications.   <\/p><p>The instructor also has a lot of experience designing courses and learning how students learn best and how to help students achieve their objectives. Experience designing technical courses has also benefit in being able to design a course in a logical fashion and deal with problems related to technical topics and the use of software like QuickBooks Desktop.   <\/p><\/div><div class=\"styles--audience--2xuzW\" data-purpose=\"target-audience\"><h2 class=\"ud-heading-xl styles--audience__title--1qhlO\">Who this course is for:<\/h2><ul class=\"styles--audience__list--16EaN\"><li>Bookkeepers who want do design a bookkeeping business using QuickBooks Pro Desktop 2019 or prior<\/li><li>Small business owners who want a simple system to enter data into QuickBooks Pro Desktop 2019 or prior to help year-end tax preparation &amp; regulatory needs<\/li><li>Small business owners who want to learn how best to work with a bookkeeper and or year-end accounting firm and tax preparer<\/li><li>Students who want to understand bookkeeping from a practical perspective<\/li><\/ul><\/div><\/div><\/div><button type=\"button\" class=\"ud-btn ud-btn-medium ud-btn-ghost ud-heading-sm show-more-module--focusable-label--19jtd\" style=\"display: none;\" data-css-toggle-id=\"u83-show-more--7\"><span><span class=\"show-more-module--show-more--2bohq\">Show more<\/span><span class=\"show-more-module--show-less--1J4F5\">Show less<\/span><\/span><svg aria-hidden=\"true\" focusable=\"false\" class=\"ud-icon ud-icon-xsmall show-more-module--show-more--2bohq\"><use xlink:href=\"#icon-expand\"><\/use><\/svg><svg aria-hidden=\"true\" focusable=\"false\" class=\"ud-icon ud-icon-xsmall show-more-module--show-less--1J4F5\"><use xlink:href=\"#icon-collapse\"><\/use><\/svg><\/button><\/div><\/div>"}
{"twitter_image":"https://img-c.udemycdn.com/course/480x270/1592366_e316_2.jpg","site":"https://www.udemy.com/course/financial-accounting-inventory-costs/?couponCode=01A9AC4787B245A718F2","course_language":"English","is_free":"true","description":"Inventory cost flow assumptions - First In First Out (FIFO), Last In Firs Out (LIFO), Weighted Average Methods","id":"219","title":"Financial Accounting \u2013 Inventory Costs","category":"Finance & Accounting","url":"financial-accounting-inventory-costs","course_description":"<div class=\"ud-text-sm component-margin styles--description--33-vq\" data-purpose=\"course-description\"><h2 data-purpose=\"description-title\" class=\"ud-heading-xl styles--description__header--2Z7Vb\">Description<\/h2><div class=\"show-more-module--container--2QPRN\"><span id=\"u221-show-more--6\" data-type=\"checkbox\" data-checked=\"\" style=\"display:none\"><\/span><div class=\"show-more-module--content--cjTh0 show-more-module--with-gradient--1ZDrA\" style=\"max-height:none\"><div tabindex=\"-1\"><div data-purpose=\"safely-set-inner-html:description:description\"><p><strong>We cover inventory costs and cost flows, including what is included in the cost of inventory and how to account for inventory freight costs, inventory insurance costs, and discount. We also discuss inventory flow assumptions including specific identification, first in first out (FIFO), last in first out (LIFO), and weighted average methods. FIFO, LIFO and weighted average methods will be discussed using both a periodic inventory system and a perpetual inventory system. <\/strong><\/p><p><strong><\/strong><strong>In addition to instructional video, this course will include downloadable<\/strong><\/p>\n<p><strong>\u2022    Downloadable PDF Files<\/strong><\/p>\n<p><strong>\u2022    Excel Practice Files<\/strong><\/p>\n<p><strong>\u2022    Multiple Choice Practice Questions<\/strong><\/p>\n<p><strong>\u2022    Short Calculation Practice Questions<\/strong><\/p>\n<p><strong>\u2022    Discussion Questions<\/strong><\/p>\n<p><strong>The PDF files allow us to download reference information we can use offline and as a guide to help us work through the material.<\/strong><\/p>\n<p><strong>Excel practice files will be preformatted so that we can focus on the adjusting process and learning some of the basics of Excel, like addition, subtraction, and cell relationships.<\/strong><\/p>\n<p><strong>Multiple choice example question helps us improve our test-taking skills by reducing the information into the size and format of multiple choice questions and discussing how to approach these questions.<\/strong><\/p>\n<p><strong>Short calculation questions help us reduce problems that have some calculation down to a short format that could be used in multiple choice questions.<\/strong><\/p>\n<p><strong>Discussion Question will provide an opportunity to discuss these topics with the instructor and other students, a process many students find very helpful because it allows us to see the topic from different viewpoints.<\/strong><\/p>\n<p><strong>Who will we be learning from?<\/strong><\/p>\n<p><strong>You will be learning from somebody who has {"twitter_image":"https://img-b.udemycdn.com/course/480x270/1517986_f8a9_3.jpg","site":"https://www.udemy.com/course/quickbooks-online-2018-start-to-finish/?couponCode=5B385EC2EC28031FD55D","course_language":"English","is_free":"true","description":"Learn QuickBooks from a Certified Public Accountant (CPA) and experienced instructor","id":"220","title":"QuickBooks Online 2023 Start to Finish","category":"Business","url":"quickbooks-online-2018-start-to-finish","course_description":"<div class=\"ud-text-sm component-margin styles--description--33-vq\" data-purpose=\"course-description\"><h2 data-purpose=\"description-title\" class=\"ud-heading-xl styles--description__header--2Z7Vb\">Description<\/h2><div class=\"show-more-module--container--2QPRN\"><span id=\"u13-show-more--7\" data-type=\"checkbox\" data-checked=\"\" style=\"display:none\"><\/span><div class=\"show-more-module--content--cjTh0 show-more-module--with-gradient--1ZDrA\" style=\"max-height:none\"><div tabindex=\"-1\"><div data-purpose=\"safely-set-inner-html:description:description\"><p>Become an Expert at QuickBooks in 1 Hour. . .: STOP!!!<\/p><p>That\u2019s A LOAD OF CRAP<\/p><p>OK, it takes a little longer to be an expert. Fortunately, this course is designed to be useful for both beginners and experts.<\/p><p>Our course starts at the basics, such as <strong>how to access the QuickBooks software, possibly for free<\/strong>, and then moves through an in-depth analysis of the software.<\/p><p>The course is designed so learners can go from start to finish but also have the option of jumping to the most relevant parts of the course, using the course as a reference guide to fall back on as needed, a dependable and up-to-date reference guide.<\/p><p><strong>We have updated this course each year and plan on continuing to do so as long as learners find it useful<\/strong>.<\/p><p>Courses on how to use software become outdated fast unless instructors are committed to updating the material, as we are. <\/p><p>The first part of the course will demonstrate how to access the QuickBooks software, possibly for free, download it, and install it.<\/p><p>We will then use the sample file provided by QuickBooks to learn how to navigate the accounting software, locate the most commonly used areas, and understand the relationship between data input and the final product of financial statements and related reports.<\/p><p>The sample file is an excellent tool for learning how to navigate the software because it already has data in it, allowing us to deconstruct the process of data input by going to the end result of financial statements and drilling back to the source documents used to enter the data.<\/p><p>We will analyze transactions by accounting cycle: vendor cycle, customer cycle, and employee cycle. The vendor cycle may also be called the payment cycle, purchases cycle, account payable cycle, or expenses cycle. The customer cycle may also be called the revenue cycle, sales cycle, or accounts receivable cycle.<\/p><p>The course will break down the flow of data input forms in each cycle and the impact of each form on the financial statements and related reports.<\/p><p>In the next major section of the course, we will start a new company file, an essential process for learning how to set up the foundational accounting system components like the chart of accounts, service items, revenue items, and beginning balances.<\/p><p>Learners will enter two months of data input along with instructional videos, entering a wide variety of common transactions and analyzing the impact of each on the financial statements and related reports.<\/p><p>After entering two months of data input, learners will prepare bank reconciliations using demonstration bank statements, learning how to perform a bank reconciliation, why we reconcile, and what outstanding items are.<\/p><p>The course also has an extensive section on how to use bank feeds. Learners will learn how to connect to the bank, download bank feeds into QuickBooks, and add the necessary data to include the bank data into the accounting system to create financial transactions or verify transactions that have already been created. We will also cover how to use bank rules to make data input much faster and more efficient. The course will demonstrate data input using bank feeds for checking, credit card, and PayPal accounts.<\/p><p>Next, we will enter adjusting entries; entries used to adjust financial statement reports more closely to their accounting basis as of the end of the month or year. Common accounting basis includes accrual basis, cash basis, or tax basis.<\/p><p>Learners will also understand how budgets fit into the accounting process, what some best practices are to construct a budget, how to enter a budget into QuickBooks, and how to run budget reports.<\/p><p>The course also has information on more specialized topics like using account numbers, customizing forms, using class tracking, memorizing transactions, and multiple currencies.<\/p><\/div><div class=\"styles--audience--2xuzW\" data-purpose=\"target-audience\"><h2 class=\"ud-heading-xl styles--audience__title--1qhlO\">Who this course is for:<\/h2><ul class=\"styles--audience__list--16EaN\"><li>Business owners<\/li><li>Accounting professionals<\/li><li>Accounting students<\/li><li>Anybody who wants to learn accounting software<\/li><\/ul><\/div><\/div><\/div><button type=\"button\" class=\"ud-btn ud-btn-medium ud-btn-ghost ud-heading-sm show-more-module--focusable-label--19jtd\" style=\"display: none;\" data-css-toggle-id=\"u13-show-more--7\"><span><span class=\"show-more-module--show-more--2bohq\">Show more<\/span><span class=\"show-more-module--show-less--1J4F5\">Show less<\/span><\/span><svg aria-hidden=\"true\" focusable=\"false\" class=\"ud-icon ud-icon-xsmall show-more-module--show-more--2bohq\"><use xlink:href=\"#icon-expand\"><\/use><\/svg><svg aria-hidden=\"true\" focusable=\"false\" class=\"ud-icon ud-icon-xsmall show-more-module--show-less--1J4F5\"><use xlink:href=\"#icon-collapse\"><\/use><\/svg><\/button><\/div><\/div>"}

accounting course to learn the accounting cycle in a practical way and pick up critical Excel fundamentals","id":"221","title":"Financial Accounting & Excel\u2013Comprehensive Accounting Course","category":"Finance & Accounting","url":"financial-accounting-excelcomprehensive-accounting-course","course_description":"<div class=\"ud-text-sm component-margin styles--description--33-vq\" data-purpose=\"course-description\"><h2 data-purpose=\"description-title\" class=\"ud-heading-xl styles--description__header--2Z7Vb\">Description<\/h2><div class=\"show-more-module--container--2QPRN\"><span id=\"u120-show-more--7\" data-type=\"checkbox\" data-checked=\"\" style=\"display:none\"><\/span><div class=\"show-more-module--content--cjTh0 show-more-module--with-gradient--1ZDrA\" style=\"max-height:none\"><div tabindex=\"-1\"><div data-purpose=\"safely-set-inner-html:description:description\"><p><strong>If we are a business owner or accounting professional who would like to get a better understanding of what our accounting software is doing<\/strong><\/p>\n<p><strong><\/strong><strong>Or<\/strong><\/p>\n<p><strong><\/strong><strong>An accounting student or student in general that would like to get a better understanding of what our accounting textbook is doing<\/strong><\/p>\n<p><strong>This course is a course for us.<\/strong><\/p>\n<p>Business owners, accounting professionals, and accounting students often have the same problem with accounting. . .<\/p>\n<p>that we are focused on one small component of the accounting process and not able to make all the necessary connections to other components of the accounting process to fully benefit from an understanding of how the business runs.<\/p>\n<p>Business owners focus on cash flow and revenue, accounting professionals focus on their component of the accounting department and enter data into the accounting software, and accounting students focus on the topic they are currently working on.<br><\/p>\n<p>Accounting professional often focus on one component of the accounting cycle like accounts receivable, accounts payable, or payroll often not having much time to consider the relationship with other areas of the accounting cycle.<\/p>\n<p>Accounting software helps simplify the data entry process, but the simplification also restricts us from seeing how the data is being processed into the end product, into financial statements and reports.<\/p>\n<p>Students are focused on one component of the accounting cycle at a time following an accounting textbook that is putting the pieces of the accounting puzzle together one step at a time.<\/p>\n<p>As students zoom their focus into the current topic, they often lose sight of it fits into the larger objective and this loss of sight causes students to question the relevance of what they are losing. Student\u2019s questioning the relevance of what they are learning causes students to lose interest. A loss of student interest causes students grades to fall.<\/p>\n<p>Part of the reason accounting textbooks have a difficult time incorporating the current topic into the big picture is that a textbook is restricted by what can fit on a page and the problems a textbook provides are restricted by what a student can accomplish with paper and pencil.<br><\/p>\n<p>The use of instructional video providing a step by step process along with Excel that allows students to sum up large columns of numbers in a short time provides the tools to create a comprehensive problem that will demonstrate current topics in the context of the entire accounting process.<\/p>\n<p><strong>Why Take This Course?<\/strong><\/p>\n<p>We will learn the accounting cycle in a comprehensive way and learn the fundamental of Excel.<\/p>\n<p>Learning the accounting process without Excel or Excel without accounting is a waste of time and not an efficient way to learn either topic.<\/p>\n<p>Like assets being equivalent to liabilities and equity, accounting is equivalent to Excel in many ways and therefore learning Excel will accelerate our learning of accounting and make what we learn more applicable.<\/p>\n<p>Accounting is also the perfect tool to learn Excel. This course will not provide a broad overview of everything Excel can do because that is not a way to learn. Courses attempting to demonstrate all the functions Excel fail to create value for learners because learners will not retain what they learn without a foundation of core concepts and a reason for learning each new function.<\/p>\n<p>This course will cover the fundamentals of Excel, those components used 99% of the time, and the components needed as a foundation for learning more about Excel.<\/p>\n<p>The core components of Excel we will learn include adding, subtracting, and summing up columns of numbers.<\/p>\n<p>We will learn the core concept of Excel through demonstration, repetition, and application to practical problems.<\/p>\n<p><strong>What Will Be Included in This Course?<\/strong><\/p>\n<p>We will complete a comprehensive problem using both instructional video and application.<\/p>\n<p>Although the course offers much more than just instructional video, it does include over 20 hours of instructional video.<\/p>\n<p>We also include an Excel worksheet with just about every presentation allowing us to both see the completed answer and work through the problems step by step along with the video.<\/p>\n<p>Each Excel workbook includes at least two tabs. One tab will have the answer so that we can see how the completed worksheet is constructed and the second tab will provide us the opportunity to enter the data along with the instructional video.<\/p>\n<p><strong>Who Will We Be Learning From?<\/strong><\/p>\n<p>We will be learning from somebody who has practical accounting experience as a practicing CPA, teaching experience, curriculum design experience.<\/p>\n<p>Credentials include:<\/p>\n<p>We are learning from someone who has both instruction and curriculum development experience needed to construct comprehensive courses of a technical nature in a way that meets students\u2019 needs and expectations.<\/p>\n<p><strong> What Will We Learn?<\/strong><\/p>\n<p>We will learn how to complete the components of the accounting cycle and the fundamental of Excel including addition, subtraction, and the sum function.<\/p>\n<p>Below is a short list of what is included in the accounting cycle and what we will cover in the course:<\/p>\n<ul><li>Journalizing journal entries<\/li><li>Posting to the general ledger<\/li><li>Create a trial balance<\/li><li>Adjusting entries<\/li><li>Bank reconciliations<\/li><li>Financial statement generation<\/li><li>Closing entries<\/li><li>Reversing entries<\/li><\/ul>\n<p><strong>How Will We Be Taught?<\/strong><\/p>\n<p>We will learn through viewing and then doing.<\/p>\n<p>We will demonstrate each component of the problem in small digestible parts using both a completed Excel worksheet and instructional video.<\/p>\n<p>We will provide an Excel worksheet that can be filled in along with the instructional video or after watching the instructional video.<\/p>\n<p><strong>Please join us in learning Accounting, Excel, debits, and credits.<\/strong><\/p>\n<p><strong>It will be Great <\/strong><strong><\/strong><\/p>\n<p><strong>Course Content Includes:<\/strong><\/p>\n<ul><li>Start a New Business Section of Accounting &amp; Fortunately, this course is designed to be useful for both beginners and experts.<\/p><p>Our course starts at the basics, such as <strong>how to access the QuickBooks software, possibly for free<\/strong>, and then moves through an in-depth analysis of the software.<\/p><p>The course is designed so learners can go from start to finish but also have the option of jumping to the most relevant parts of the course, using the course as a reference guide to fall back on as needed, a dependable and up-to-date reference guide.<\/p><p><strong>We have updated this course each year and plan on continuing to do so as long as learners find it useful<\/strong>.<\/p><p>Courses on how to use software become outdated fast unless instructors are committed to updating the material, as we are. We also show lectures using the prior software versions, which will be relevant if you use an older version.<\/p><p><strong>This course will include backup files,<\/strong> a great tool to jump ahead or rework a portion of a problem. The backup files allow learners to have the exact same data as the example problem, so they can follow the presentation and perform the task in an easy, step-by-step process.<\/p><p>The first part of the course will demonstrate how to access the QuickBooks software, possibly for free, download it, and install it.<\/p><p>We will then use the sample file provided by QuickBooks to learn how to navigate the accounting software, locate the most commonly used areas, and understand the relationship between data input and the final product of financial statements and related reports.<\/p><p>The sample file is an excellent tool for learning how to navigate the software because it already has data in it, allowing us to deconstruct the process of data input by going to the end result of financial statements and drilling back to the source documents used to enter the data.<\/p><p>We will analyze transactions by accounting cycle: vendor cycle, customer cycle, and employee cycle. The vendor cycle may also be called the payment cycle, purchases cycle, account payable cycle, or expenses cycle. The customer cycle may also be called the revenue cycle, sales cycle, or accounts receivable cycle.<\/p><p>The course will break down the flow of data input forms in each cycle and the impact of each form on the financial statements and related reports.<\/p><p>In the next major section of the course, we will start a new company file, an essential process for learning how to set up the foundational accounting system components like the chart of accounts, service items, revenue items, and beginning balances.<\/p><p>Learners will enter two months of data input along with instructional videos, entering a wide variety of common transactions and analyzing the impact of each on the financial statements and related reports.<\/p><p>After entering two months of data input, learners will prepare bank reconciliations using demonstration bank statements, learning how to perform a bank reconciliation, why we reconcile, and what outstanding items are.<\/p><p>The course also has an extensive section on how to use bank feeds. Learners will learn how to connect to the bank, download bank feeds into QuickBooks, and add the necessary data to include the bank data into the accounting system to create financial transactions or verify transactions that have already been created. We will also cover how to use bank rules to make data input much faster and more efficient. The course will demonstrate data input using bank feeds for checking, credit card, and PayPal accounts.<\/p><p>Next, we will enter adjusting entries; entries used to adjust financial statement reports more closely to their accounting basis as of the end of the month or year. Common accounting basis includes accrual basis, cash basis, or tax basis.<\/p><p>Learners will also understand how budgets fit into the accounting process, what some best practices are to construct a budget, how to enter a budget into QuickBooks, and how to run budget reports.<\/p><p>The course also has information on more specialized topics like using account numbers, customizing forms, using class tracking, memorizing transactions, fixed asset tracking, tax mapping, and multiple currencies.<\/p><\/div><div class=\"styles--audience--2xuzW\" data-purpose=\"target-audience\"><h2 class=\"ud-heading-xl styles--audience__title--1qhlO\">Who this course is for:<\/h2><ul class=\"styles--audience__list--16EaN\"><li>Business Owners<\/li><li>Accounting Professionals<\/li><li>Accounting Students<\/li><li>Anybody who wants to learn accounting software<\/li><\/ul><\/div><\/div><\/div><button type=\"button\" class=\"ud-btn ud-btn-medium ud-btn-ghost ud-heading-sm show-more-module--focusable-label--19jtd\" style=\"display: none;\" data-css-toggle-id=\"u102-show-more--7\"><span><span class=\"show-more-module--show-more--2bohq\">Show more<\/span><span class=\"show-more-module--show-less--1J4F5\">Show less<\/span><\/span><svg aria-hidden=\"true\" focusable=\"false\" class=\"ud-icon ud-icon-xsmall show-more-module--show-more--2bohq\"><use xlink:href=\"#icon-expand\"><\/use><\/svg><svg aria-hidden=\"true\" focusable=\"false\" class=\"ud-icon ud-icon-xsmall show-more-module--show-less--1J4F5\"><use xlink:href=\"#icon-collapse\"><\/use><\/svg><\/button><\/div><\/div>"}

{"twitter_image":"https://img-c.udemycdn.com/course/480x270/5114376_18d7_2.jpg","site":"https://www.udemy.com/course/wastewater-treatment-explained/?couponCode=F1631F827804983CFA8B","course_language":"English","is_free":"true","description":"What you need to know about Wastewater","id":"228","title":"Sanitation & Wastewater Treatment Explained","category":"Teaching & Academics","url":"wastewater-treatment-explained","course_description":"<div class=\"ud-text-sm component-margin styles--description--33-vq\" data-purpose=\"course-description\"><h2 data-purpose=\"description-title\" class=\"ud-heading-xl styles--description__header--2Z7Vb\">Description<\/h2><div class=\"show-more-module--container--2QPRN\"><span id=\"u211-show-more--6\" data-type=\"checkbox\" data-checked=\"\" style=\"display:none\"><\/span><div class=\"show-more-module--content--cjTh0 show-more-module--with-gradient--1ZDrA\" style=\"max-height:none\"><div tabindex=\"-1\"><div data-purpose=\"safely-set-inner-html:description:description\"><p><em>Every day, we use water for our basic needs, such as drinking, bathing, cleaning, cooking, and laundry. However, by doing so, we generate every day millions of liters of wastewater which end up in the sewage network.<\/em><\/p><p><em>These sewage networks transport all wastewater to large facilities called wastewater treatment plants. where it undergoes complex transformations to make it less harmful to the receiving ecosystem.<\/em><\/p><p><em>Managing daily flows of millions of liters of wastewater can be challenging, as it threatens public health and ecosystems.<\/em><\/p><p><em>For a better understanding of how cities manage daily generated wastewater fluxes, we will discuss in this course the topics of sanitation, wastewater, and wastewater treatment from many angles.<\/em><\/p><p><em>To do so, we will use the following plan :<\/em><\/p><p><br><\/p><p><strong>Introduction<\/strong><\/p><p><strong>Chapter 1: Sanitation &amp; hygiene<\/strong><\/p><p><strong>Chapter 2: Consequences and challenges of unsafe sanitation<\/strong><\/p><p><strong>Chapter 3: Wastewater characterization<\/strong><\/p><p><strong>Chapter 4: Importance of wastewater treatment<\/strong><\/p><p><strong>Chapter 5: Basic concepts of wastewater treatment<\/strong><\/p><p><strong>Chapter 6: Wastewater treatment processes<\/strong><\/p><p><strong>Chapter 7: Challenges of wastewater treatment <\/strong><\/p><p><strong>Conclusion<\/strong><\/p><p><br><\/p><p>By the end of this course, you should be able to have a better understanding of domestic wastewater management works and the importance to have safe sanitation.<\/p><p><em>I hope you enroll &amp; enjoy the course!<\/em><\/p><p>You can check more courses on drinking water treatment and seawater desalination on Green Courses.<\/p><\/div><div class=\"styles--audience--2xuzW\" data-purpose=\"target-audience\"><h2 class=\"ud-heading-xl styles--audience__title--1qhlO\">Who this course is for:<\/h2><ul class=\"styles--audience__list--16EaN\"><li>Beginners and general public interested in wastewater management<\/li><\/ul><\/div><\/div><\/div><button type=\"button\" class=\"ud-btn ud-btn-medium ud-btn-ghost ud-heading-sm show-more-module--focusable-label--19jtd\" style=\"display: none;\" data-css-toggle-id=\"u211-show-more--6\"><span><span class=\"show-more-module--show-more--2bohq\">Show more<\/span><span class=\"show-more-module--show-less--1J4F5\">Show less<\/span><\/span><svg aria-hidden=\"true\" focusable=\"false\" class=\"ud-icon ud-icon-xsmall show-more-module--show-more--2bohq\"><use xlink:href=\"#icon-expand\"><\/use><\/svg><svg aria-hidden=\"true\" focusable=\"false\" class=\"ud-icon ud-icon-xsmall show-more-module--show-less--1J4F5\"><use xlink:href=\"#icon-collapse\"><\/use><\/svg><\/button><\/div><\/div>"}

This course is a chance to shorten your learning curve and bypass the time-consuming and costly mistakes that other online course creators frequently make, but rarely talk about in public, until now.<\/p><p>Please note: this is not the course to take if you are looking for technical advice on what camera or mic to buy.<\/p><p>Note: this should not be the first or only course you purchase on online course creation. Wouldn't it be nice to know that investors will perceive you as confident, competent and that they fully understand why your business has great potential upside?  <\/p><p>  In this <strong>Investing<\/strong> Presentations: How to Deliver an IPO Road Show Presentation course you will learn the following:  <\/p><p>  * How to avoid the most common blunders that plague IPO road show presentations  <\/p><p>  * How to make your legal and investment banking team happy, and still give an interesting presentation  <\/p><p>  * How to deal with boring slides and lots of data  <\/p><p>  * How to engage and connect with your investor audience  <\/p><p>This <strong>Investing<\/strong> Presentations course is delivered primarily through spoken lecture. Because the skill you are learning is speaking related, it only makes sense that you learn through speaking.<br><\/p><p>  The <strong>Investing<\/strong> Presentations skill you will learn in this class is not primarily theoretical or academic. It is a skill that requires physical habits. That is why you will be asked to take part in numerous exercises where you record yourself speaking on video, and then watching yourself. Learning presentation skills is like learning how to ride a bicycle. You simply have to do it numerous times and work past the wobbling and falling off parts until you get it right.  <\/p><p>  This <strong>Investing<\/strong> Presentations course contains numerous video lectures plus several bonus books for your training library.  <\/p><p>  TJ Walker has been coaching and training people on their presentation skills for 30 years. Now, through the power of Udemy's online platform, he is able to give you the same high quality training that he gives in person to CEOs, Fortune 500 executives, and Presidents of countries. Only you can now receive the training at a tiny fraction of the normal fee for in-person training.  <\/p><p>  How long this <strong>Investing<\/strong> Presentations course takes is up to you. The longest part of the course involves you speaking on video, critiquing yourself, and doing it over until you like it. But if you get to the point where you love how you look and sound when you present it will be well worth the time spent. And having this skill will save you time for all future presentations in your life.  <\/p><p>  You can begin improving your presentation skills right now. You may have an opportunity to speak out as soon as tomorrow, so why waste another day worried that your presentation skills are not up to high standards. <\/p><p>Enroll in this <strong>Investing<\/strong> Presentations course today.<\/p><p>There is a 100% Money-Back Guarantee for this course. However, we will also provide PDF files of the tax forms so learners can enter the data directly into the tax forms as we go. The tax forms can also be found on the IRS website.<\/p><p>The course will demonstrate how to enter the data into the tax forms in stages to reduce potential mistakes and to identify mistakes as they happen so they can be fixed as easily as possible.<\/p><p>We will start the data input with the balance sheet.<\/p><p>Then we will enter the income statement as it is formatted in the adjusted trial balance.<\/p><p>Next, we will systematically go through the M-1 adjustments. We will isolate these adjustments, reviewing them on the tax forms, in the software, and using our Excel worksheet.<\/p><p>We will then review the tax forms.<\/p><\/div><div class=\"styles--audience--2xuzW\" data-purpose=\"target-audience\"><h2 class=\"ud-heading-xl styles--audience__title--1qhlO\">Who this course is for:<\/h2><ul class=\"styles--audience__list--16EaN\"><li>Tax professionals<\/li><li>Business owners considering a Partnership form of business entity<\/li><li>Tax and accounting students<\/li><\/ul><\/div><\/div><\/div><button type=\"button\" class=\"ud-btn ud-btn-medium ud-btn-ghost ud-heading-sm show-more-module--focusable-label--19jtd\" style=\"display: none;\" data-css-toggle-id=\"u150-show-more--6\"><span><span class=\"show-more-module--show-more--2bohq\">Show more<\/span><span class=\"show-more-module--show-less--1J4F5\">Show less<\/span><\/span><svg aria-hidden=\"true\" focusable=\"false\" class=\"ud-icon ud-icon-xsmall show-more-module--show-more--2bohq\"><use xlink:href=\"#icon-expand\"><\/use><\/svg><svg aria-hidden=\"true\" focusable=\"false\" class=\"ud-icon ud-icon-xsmall show-more-module--show-less--1J4F5\"><use xlink:href=\"#icon-collapse\"><\/use><\/svg><\/button><\/div><\/div>"}
{"twitter_image":"https://img-c.udemycdn.com/course/480x270/2714022_7d92.jpg","site":"https://www.udemy.com/course/partnership-income-tax-form-1065/?couponCode=B3D6F103869F3055FA41","course_language":"English","is_free":"true","description":"Learn to enter tax data for a Partnership into tax Form 1065 from a CPA","id":"262","title":"Partnership Income Tax (Form 1065)","category":"Finance & Accounting","url":"partnership-income-tax-form-1065","course_description":"<div class=\"ud-text-sm component-margin styles--description--33-vq\" data-purpose=\"course-description\"><h2 data-purpose=\"description-title\" class=\"ud-heading-xl styles--description__header--2Z7Vb\">Description<\/h2><div class=\"show-more-module--container--2QPRN\"><span id=\"u186-show-more--6\" data-type=\"checkbox\" data-checked=\"\" style=\"display:none\"><\/span><div class=\"show-more-module--content--cjTh0 show-more-module--with-gradient--1ZDrA\" style=\"max-height:none\"><div tabindex=\"-1\"><div data-purpose=\"safely-set-inner-html:description:description\"><p>This course currently consists of a comprehensive problem showing the data input process of a Partnership into tax Form 1065.<\/p><p>This course will put together a systematic format of entering data into a Form 1065 that will minimize errors, isolate problems as they happen, and remove the possibility of having to start the process all over again.<\/p><p>We will enter each M-1 adjustment individually into both the tax return and an Excel worksheet so that we fully understand how they work.<\/p><p>We will start by reviewing the data for the comprehensive problem.<\/p><p>Then we will enter the data into an Excel worksheet that will be used to help us organize the information.<\/p><p>We will be using Lacerte Tax software to enter the tax data into Form 1065. However, we will also provide PDF files of the tax forms so learners can enter the data directly into the tax forms as we go. The tax forms can also be found on the IRS website.<\/p><p>The course will demonstrate how to enter the data into the tax forms in stages to reduce potential mistakes and to identify mistakes as they happen so they can be fixed as easily as possible.<\/p><p>We will start the data input with the balance sheet.<\/p><p>Then we will enter the income statement as it is formatted in the adjusted trial balance.<\/p><p>Next, we will systematically go through Schedule K and M-1 adjustments. We will isolate these adjustments, reviewing them on the tax forms, in the software, and using our Excel worksheet.<\/p><p>We will then review the tax forms.<\/p><p>Next, we will review the Form K-1s and basic calculations.<\/p><p>The course will demonstrate the exporting of the K-1 Form to the individual Form 1040 for an owner of the Partnership, showing the flow through process.<\/p><\/div><div class=\"styles--audience--2xuzW\" data-purpose=\"target-audience\"><h2 class=\"ud-heading-xl styles--audience__title--1qhlO\">Who this course is for:<\/h2><ul class=\"styles--audience__list--16EaN\"><li>Tax professionals<\/li><li>Business owners considering a Partnership form of business entity<\/li><li>Tax and accounting students<\/li><\/ul><\/div><\/div><\/div><button type=\"button\" class=\"ud-btn ud-btn-medium ud-btn-ghost ud-heading-sm show-more-module--focusable-label--19jtd\" style=\"display: none;\" data-css-toggle-id=\"u186-show-more--6\"><span><span class=\"show-more-module--show-more--2bohq\">Show more<\/span><span class=\"show-more-module--show-less--1J4F5\">Show less<\/span><\/span><svg aria-hidden=\"true\" focusable=\"false\" class=\"ud-icon ud-icon-xsmall show-more-module--show-more--2bohq\"><use xlink:href=\"#icon-expand\"><\/use><\/svg><svg aria-hidden=\"true\" focusable=\"false\" class=\"ud-icon ud-icon-xsmall show-more-module--show-less--1J4F5\"><use xlink:href=\"#icon-collapse\"><\/use><\/svg><\/button><\/div><\/div>"}

One problem will be for a charitable organization, one for a health care organization, and one for a not for profit school.<\/p><p>We will learn how to set up a QuickBooks file for a not for profit organization.<\/p><p>The course will show how to create a chart of accounts and items list for a not for profit organization.<\/p><p>Learners will learn how to enter data into the QuickBooks system using forms.<\/p><p>We will learn how to customize forms so that they can be used to provide to donors.<\/p><p>The course will show how to generate and analyze reports. We will also learn to use the job costing feature to track each restricted item in detail.<\/p><p>The course will provide backup files that allow learners to jump forward or rework any part of the comprehensive problem.<\/p><p>We will also provide Excel files as we work through the problem. We will break each comprehensive problem done and enter it into the system one journal entry at a time. We will show how the journal entry would be entered using debits and credits in Excel first, and then enter the transaction into QuickBooks. Excel is a more transparent system, making it easier to see and understand the connections. Once we understand the objective, we will then move to QuickBooks to enter the data. The system of first Entering data into Excel to understand the objective will be very useful when we need to use more complex features like class tracking and job costing.<\/p><\/div><div class=\"styles--audience--2xuzW\" data-purpose=\"target-audience\"><h2 class=\"ud-heading-xl styles--audience__title--1qhlO\">Who this course is for:<\/h2><ul class=\"styles--audience__list--16EaN\"><li>Employees of a not for profit organization<\/li><li>Students who what to apply accounting theory to software<\/li><\/ul><\/div><\/div><\/div><button type=\"button\" class=\"ud-btn ud-btn-medium ud-btn-ghost ud-heading-sm show-more-module--focusable-label--19jtd\" style=\"display: none;\" data-css-toggle-id=\"u150-show-more--6\"><span><span class=\"show-more-module--show-more--2bohq\">Show more<\/span><span class=\"show-more-module--show-less--1J4F5\">Show less<\/span><\/span><svg aria-hidden=\"true\" focusable=\"false\" class=\"ud-icon ud-icon-xsmall show-more-module--show-more--2bohq\"><use xlink:href=\"#icon-expand\"><\/use><\/svg><svg aria-hidden=\"true\" focusable=\"false\" class=\"ud-icon ud-icon-xsmall show-more-module--show-less--1J4F5\"><use xlink:href=\"#icon-collapse\"><\/use><\/svg><\/button><\/div><\/div>"}

We will discuss the pros and cons of using this option.<\/strong><\/p><\/div><div class=\"styles--audience--2xuzW\" data-purpose=\"target-audience\"><h2 class=\"ud-heading-xl styles--audience__title--1qhlO\">Who this course is for:<\/h2><ul class=\"styles--audience__list--16EaN\"><li>Business professionals in an industry using job costing<\/li><li>Accounting professionals who want to learn job costing<\/li><li>Students who want to apply job costing concepts to accounting software<\/li><\/ul><\/div><\/div><\/div><button type=\"button\" class=\"ud-btn ud-btn-medium ud-btn-ghost ud-heading-sm show-more-module--focusable-label--19jtd\" style=\"display: none;\" data-css-toggle-id=\"u42-show-more--6\"><span><span class=\"show-more-module--show-more--2bohq\">Show more<\/span><span class=\"show-more-module--show-less--1J4F5\">Show less<\/span><\/span><svg aria-hidden=\"true\" focusable=\"false\" class=\"ud-icon ud-icon-xsmall show-more-module--show-more--2bohq\"><use xlink:href=\"#icon-expand\"><\/use><\/svg><svg aria-hidden=\"true\" focusable=\"false\" class=\"ud-icon ud-icon-xsmall show-more-module--show-less--1J4F5\"><use xlink:href=\"#icon-collapse\"><\/use><\/svg><\/button><\/div><\/div>"}

However, we will discuss the differences between nongovernmental not for profit organization and governmental not-for-profit organizations. We will also discuss accounting concepts for both governmental and nongovernmental organizations related to health care and colleges.<\/p><p>The course will start by introducing what a not for profit organization is. We will discuss regulation, taxation, and performance issues related to the not for profit organization. As we discuss accounting for not for profit organization, we will make comparisons to for profit organizations, concentrating most of our time on the areas where accounting concepts differ between the two.<\/p><p>Next, we will get into the details of accounting for not for profit organizations, discussing generally accepted accounting principles and the recording of transactions.<\/p><p>We will then take a look at example problems, recoding transactions related to a not for profit organization. We will work through example problems in a presentation format. We will then provide Excel worksheets and step by step instructional videos for learners to apply what they have learned. The Excel worksheets will include two tabs, one with the completed answer, and a second with preformatted worksheets. Learners can enter data into the preformatted worksheets in a step by step process following instructional videos.<\/p><p>Next, we will discuss colleges and universities in detail. We compare and contrast governmental not-for-profit colleges and universities as well as nongovernmental not-for-profit colleges. We will also discuss for-profit colleges.<\/p><p>The course will present example problems in a presentation format and will then provide Excel worksheet and instructional videos so that learners can apply what they have learned.<\/p><p>Next, we will discuss health care organizations in detail. We will consider both governmental health care organizations and nongovernmental health care organizations. {"twitter_image":"https://img-c.udemycdn.com/course/480x270/2512030_67fb.jpg","site":"https://www.udemy.com/course/audit-financial-statement/?couponCode=D52E404C2B6ACA399FA9","course_language":"English","is_free":"true","description":"Learn the audit process from planning to audit report form a Certified Public Accountant (CPA).","id":"268","title":"Audit - Financial Statement","category":"Finance & Accounting","url":"audit-financial-statement","course_description":"<div class=\"ud-text-sm component-margin styles--description--33-vq\" data-purpose=\"course-description\"><h2 data-purpose=\"description-title\" class=\"ud-heading-xl styles--description__header--2Z7Vb\">Description<\/h2><div class=\"show-more-module--container--2QPRN\"><span id=\"u111-show-more--8\" data-type=\"checkbox\" data-checked=\"\" style=\"display:none\"><\/span><div class=\"show-more-module--content--cjTh0 show-more-module--with-gradient--1ZDrA\" style=\"max-height:none\"><div tabindex=\"-1\"><div data-purpose=\"safely-set-inner-html:description:description\"><p>Audit-Financial Accounting will discuss, in detail, the auditing process of financial statements.<\/p><p>The course will start by discussing what an audit is, as well as what the terms attest engagement and assurances services mean.<\/p><p>We will discuss the audit environment, the general format of a public accounting firm, and the general format of an audit team that would conduct the procedures related to an audit. The course will also discuss regulations and regulatory institutions related to the audit process.<\/p><p>The course will cover the planning process for an audit engagement. The planning process is a very important component of the audit because it will outline the steps that will be taking. The highest levels of the public accounting firm are generally involved in the planning process.<\/p><p>We will consider how to assess risk related to the audit using an audit risk Model. The risk assessment will help us plan the audit and determine where the auditors time can be spent most efficiently to gather evidence to support the auditor\u2019s conclusion and opinion.<\/p><p>Learners will learn the different formats of audit evidence and how to document audit evidence so that it can be used as evidence to support the conclusion and opinion of the auditor.<\/p><p>We will exam the internal controls of the organization. Internal controls are policies set up by management to achieve the objectives of the organization. As auditors, we are primarily concerned with internal controls that will lower the risk of financial statements being materially misstated. If we can rely on internal controls as an auditor, we may be able to do more testing of the controls and less substantive testing, and this can be more efficient.<\/p><p>The course will discuss the audit sampling methods. When applying testing procedures, auditors often need to test a sample of a population and then apply the results to the population as a whole. Different sampling methods are appropriate for different situations and assertions being tested.<\/p><p>Next, we will talk about substantive tests. Substantive tests include tests that most people think of when they think of an audit, like pulling files, counting inventory, and performing procedures at the company\u2019s place of business. Substantive testing will include testing account balances and transactions.<\/p><p>We will then cover audit procedures related to specific processes, including the revenue process, the purchasing process, and the payroll and human resources process.<\/p><p>Next will cover the audit process for specific accounts like inventory, prepaid expenses, intangible assets, property plant and equipment, long term debt &amp; equity.<\/p><p>Then we will discuss the audit process related to cash, cash being a very important account because it is involved in almost every other accounting process at some point.<\/p><p>Learners will then learn how to put together a standard audit report. The standard audit report is called an unqualifies report. It is beneficial to actually memorize or have a good idea of the format of the standard unqualifies report. We can then think about variations on the standard unqualified report, adjusting it as necessary.<\/p><p><strong>CPE (Continuing Professional Education)<\/strong><\/p><p><strong>Learning Objectives<\/strong><\/p><p>1. Describe what an audit engagement is and the objectives of the audit engagement<\/p><p>2. Explain how learning the audit process can enhance an accountant\u2019s understanding of financial accounting concepts<\/p><p>3. Discuss the general format and structure of a public accounting firm<\/p><p>4. Outline the general format and structure of an audit team<\/p><p>5. Describe how to plan an audit<\/p><p>6. Explain how to assess risk and use risk assessment in the planning process<\/p><p>7. Discuss the concept of materiality and how it applies to audit planning and procedures<\/p><p>8. Outline internal controls, tests of internal controls, and the role they play in the audit process<\/p><p>9. List audit sampling procedures<\/p><p>10. List substantive testing procedures<\/p><p>11. Discuss audit testing procedures related to the revenue process<\/p><p>12. Explain audit testing procedures related to the purchasing process<\/p><p>13. Identify audit testing procedures related to payroll and human resources<\/p><p>14. Describe audit testing procedures related to inventory<\/p><p>15. Explain audit testing procedures related to prepaid expenses, intangible assets, &amp; PP&amp;E<\/p><p>16. Outline audit testing procedures related to long term debt equity and cash<\/p><p>17. Discuss the format of audit reports<\/p><p>18. Explain the concepts of professional conduct and independents<\/p><p>For additional information, including refunds and complaints, please see <strong>Udemy Terms of Use<\/strong>, which is linked from the footer of this page.<\/p><p>For more information regarding administrative policies, please contact our support using the <strong>Help and Support<\/strong> link at the bottom of this page.<\/p><\/div><div class=\"styles--audience--2xuzW\" data-purpose=\"target-audience\"><h2 class=\"ud-heading-xl styles--audience__title--1qhlO\">Who this course is for:<\/h2><ul class=\"styles--audience__list--16EaN\"><li>Professionals working in public accounting<\/li><li>Accounting students<\/li><li>Accounting professionals who want to expand their understanding of accounting<\/li><li>Accounting professionals who work with auditors<\/li><\/ul><\/div><\/div><\/div><button type=\"button\" class=\"ud-btn ud-btn-medium ud-btn-ghost ud-heading-sm show-more-module--focusable-label--19jtd\" style=\"display: none;\" data-css-toggle-id=\"u111-show-more--8\"><span><span class=\"show-more-module--show-more--2bohq\">Show more<\/span><span class=\"show-more-module--show-less--1J4F5\">Show less<\/span><\/span><svg aria-hidden=\"true\" focusable=\"false\" class=\"ud-icon ud-icon-xsmall show-more-module--show-more--2bohq\"><use xlink:href=\"#icon-expand\"><\/use><\/svg><svg aria-hidden=\"true\" focusable=\"false\" class=\"ud-icon ud-icon-xsmall show-more-module--show-less--1J4F5\"><use xlink:href=\"#icon-collapse\"><\/use><\/svg><\/button><\/div><\/div>"}

Many governmental accounts are new to many learners, and we will be using different accounting methods than just an accrual method. Posting transactions and seeing a trial balance will be very helpful in learning the material and is something lacking in most courses on the subject.<\/strong><\/p><p><strong>We will discuss the governmental accounting objectives and reporting requirements, comparing them to for-profit entities. The course will assume we are familiar with for-profit accounting and will, therefore, focus on the areas of governmental accounting that are different, although we will continue to work with core concepts like the double entry accounting system.<\/strong><\/p><p><strong>Learners and instructor will examine state and local governmental accounting principles &amp; financial reporting.<\/strong><\/p><p><strong>We will record transactions for budgetary accounts &amp; encumbrances. Recording budgetary accounts will be new for many learners familiar with financial accounting, but we will use double entry accounting principles for the process.<\/strong><\/p><p><strong>The course will explain and analyze governmental operating statement accounts &amp; budgetary accounts.<\/strong><\/p><p><strong>Learners and instructor will record transactions for encumbrances, expenditures, &amp; delinquent receivables. We will emphasize when a modified accrual method will be used, and what the differences in recording financial transactions will be when used, as compared to an accrual method.<\/strong><\/p><p><strong>We will record transactions related to revenue in both the General Fund and at the government-wide activities level.<\/strong><\/p><p><strong>The course will discuss tax anticipation notes and how they will be recorded under a modified accrual method.<\/strong><\/p><p><strong>Learners and instructor will explore many examples of the closing process, closing out temporary accounts. We will compare the closing process for governmental entities to the closing process in for-profit accounting.<\/strong><\/p><p><strong>We will examine how to create subsidiary ledgers related to revenue, estimated revenue, appropriations, encumbrances, and expenditures.<\/strong><\/p><p><strong>The course will provide examples of recording supplies using the consumption method and purchases method, explaining the differences between the two.<\/strong><\/p><\/div><div class=\"styles--audience--2xuzW\" data-purpose=\"target-audience\"><h2 class=\"ud-heading-xl styles--audience__title--1qhlO\">Who this course is for:<\/h2><ul class=\"styles--audience__list--16EaN\"><li>Accounting students<\/li><li>CPA Exam Candidates<\/li><\/ul><\/div><\/div><\/div><button type=\"button\" class=\"ud-btn ud-btn-medium ud-btn-ghost ud-heading-sm show-more-module--focusable-label--19jtd\" style=\"display: none;\" data-css-toggle-id=\"u215-show-more--7\"><span><span class=\"show-more-module--show-more--2bohq\">Show more<\/span><span class=\"show-more-module--show-less--1J4F5\">Show less<\/span><\/span><svg aria-hidden=\"true\" focusable=\"false\" class=\"ud-icon ud-icon-xsmall show-more-module--show-more--2bohq\"><use xlink:href=\"#icon-expand\"><\/use><\/svg><svg aria-hidden=\"true\" focusable=\"false\" class=\"ud-icon ud-icon-xsmall show-more-module--show-less--1J4F5\"><use xlink:href=\"#icon-collapse\"><\/use><\/svg><\/button><\/div><\/div>"}
